item.title: Sony Announces Helldivers And Horizon Zero Dawn Movies
item.content:encoded:
https://kotaku.com/helldivers-2-horizon-zero-dawn-movie-ghost-tsushima-1851733809

Sony has big Hollywood plans for its hit gaming franchises. The PlayStation 5 maker announced a series of new movie spin-offs at CES 2025 this week, including movie versions of Helldivers 2 and Horizon Zero Dawn, as well as an anime spin-off of Ghost of Tsushima.

Horizon Zero Dawn, a game about fighting giant robotic monsters that have taken over earth, will be brought to the big screen through a partnership between PlayStation Productions and Columbia Pictures, Sony announced onstage at its CES press conference on Monday. The Helldivers adaptation, meanwhile, will be made by Sony Pictures. Neither has a projected release date yet, which makes sense at least in Helldivers’ case. No one expected it to be such a big hit just a year ago. 

Of course, Helldivers 2, a militaristic parody of a futuristic fascist empire fighting off alien invaders, is sort of already a movie. It’s called Starship Troopers, the Paul Verhoeven action comedy based on the sci-fi novel by Robert Heinlein. Then again, this wouldn’t be the first time Sony made a movie from a game that’s loosely inspired by another movie. That is, after all, effectively what the Uncharted adaptation was, which starred Tom Holland as the Indiana Jones-esque treasure hunter Nathan Drake.

Sony also revealed that Ghost of Tsushima will be getting an anime series called Legends. It’s being made for the streaming service Crunchyroll by Aniplex, the studio behind Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba, and directed by Takanobu Mizuno, known for Star Wars: Visions -“The Duel.” It’s a ways off, though, as Ghost of Tsushima: Legends isn’t set to release until 2027. In the meantime, the 2020 game’s sequel, Ghost of Yotei, is set to arrive on PS5 late this year.

item.title: HBO's The Last Of Us Season 2 Gets New Trailer And Surprise April Release Date
item.content:encoded:
https://kotaku.com/hbo-last-of-us-season-2-part-ii-trailer-joel-ellie-ces-1851733793

HBO’s adaptation of The Last of Us returns for season 2 in just a few months. Sony revealed the hit horror game will be back on TV with fresh episodes beginning in April and dropped a new trailer for fans to pore over in the meantime.

The Last of Us season 2's April 2025 release was announced tonight during Sony’s press conference at CES 2025. It was an odd place to drop blockbuster entertainment news, but fans of Naughty Dog’s post-apocalyptic series ultimately won’t care. They now have a new 60-second trailer full of short references to pivotal moments in the games.

Take a look:

The first season of The Last of Us debuted on HBO back in 2023. It covers the events of the first game, originally released for PlayStation 3 a decade prior, with the events of The Last of Us Part II largely expected to be divided between season 2 and a future season 3.

Starring Pedro Pascal as Joel and Bella Ramsey as Ellie, the show follows a surrogate father-daughter pair as they navigate the violent vestiges of humanity after a deadly disease wipes out society as we know it. Guided by showrunners Craig Mazin, best known for the mini-series Chernobyl, and Neil Druckmann, the lead writer and director of the games, HBO’s adaptation ended up being one of 2023's hit shows, proving games could be good fodder for prestige TV under the right circumstances.

The Last of Us is now spearheading Sony’s game-to-TV-and-movie pipeline, with Helldivers, Horizon Zero Dawn, and Ghost of Tsushima all getting various spin-offs in the next few years. A God of War series is also in development, though its timeline remains up in the air following recent departures from the writing and directing teams.
